title: Pope Francis shows world his health is improving two months after hospitalization for bronchitis
description: Almost two months after being hospitalized for bronchitis, Pope Francis thanked the doctors that caught the infection in a conversation with Telemundo. NBC News’ Anne Thompson reports on the Pontiff’s virtual town hall with young people around the world.

title: Mexico's president urges Latinos not to vote for DeSantis, slams hardline immigration stance
description: Mexican President López Obrador urged Latino voters not to back Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis in the next presidential election, slamming his hardline immigration stance.

title: Cuba's rural towns are hit hard with fuel shortages
description: Cuba’s fuel shortage is hitting rural villages particularly hard, with residents resorting to coal fires to cook their food and days and nights in fuel lines.

title: Man drives into gates of Downing Street, British prime minister's home
description: A man was arrested after he drove his car into the gates of Downing Street where British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak lives. NBC's Ali Arouzi reports.

title: Connecticut woman's leg bit off in shark attack in Turks and Caicos, police say
description: A 22-year-old Connecticut woman had her leg bitten off in a shark attack while she and a friend were snorkeling in Turks and Caicos, local police said.

title: Watch: Passersby panic as car crashes into gates of Downing Street
description: CCTV shows a small, silver car driving slowly into the security gates of the historic street where British prime ministers live while in office. Police responded quickly and arrested the driver.

title: U.S. Navy destroyer sunk in WWII discovered off the Japanese coast
Iran test-fires latest version of ballistic missile with a 1,240-mile range
description: Authorities showed off the Khorramshahr-4 to journalists at an event in Tehran, with the missile on a truck-mounted launcher.

title: Doing the Nutbush: One country's strange love affair with Tina Turner
description: Many Australians feel a special connection to Tina Turner, with one of her early songs having found a unique place in the country’s culture.

title: Malaysia raids Swatch stores and seizes rainbow pride watches
description: Swiss company Swatch said Malaysian officials raided its stores and seized watches from its Pride Collection because they “bore LGBT connotations.”

title: Germany cracks down on far-right coup plot suspects with more arrests
description: Germany arrested three more suspected coup plotters accused of membership in an organization linked to the Reichsbürger movement, the federal chief prosecutor said.

title: Mercenary chief Prigozhin says his forces are handing control of Bakhmut to Russia's army
description: The head of the Russian private military contractor Wagner claimed Thursday that his forces have started pulling out of Bakhmut, in eastern Ukraine, and handing over control to the Russian military, days after he said Wagner troops had captured the ruined city.

title: China faces a new Covid wave that could peak at 65 million cases a week
description: China is bracing for a new wave of Covid-19 infections that could see as many as 65 million cases per week by the time the surge peaks at the end of June.

title: Tina Turner fans pay tribute to the star outside her Swiss home
description: Neighbors laid flowers at the Swiss home of singer Tina Turner following her death there on Wednesday aged 83.

title: Border raid exposes Russian defenses and divisions
description: A cross-border incursion into Russia's Belgorod from Ukraine sparked days of chaotic fighting that have fueled new disquiet about the Kremlin's ability to defend its territory without leaving its military exposed on the front lines.

title: Iran unveils latest version of ballistic missile amid wider tensions over nuclear program
description: Iran unveiled on Thursday what it dubbed the latest iteration of its liquid-fueled Khorramshahr ballistic missile amid wider tensions with the West over its nuclear program.
